column1: #Text=David Hicks transferred from Guantanamo Bay to Australian prison

#Text=Australian David Hicks , held for the past five years at the U.S. Guantanamo Bay detention camp in Cuba , was flown to Adelaide , South Australia Sunday on board an Australian government-chartered aircraft .
#Text=Hicks is now in the custody of South Australian Correctional Services .
#Text=At a recent U.S. war crimes tribunal , Hicks pleaded guilty to providing material support to a listed terrorist organisation and was sentenced to seven years in prison .
#Text=As part of the plea agreement , all but nine months of the sentence was suspended , which he will be allowed to serve out in an Australian prison .

#Text=" He [ Hicks ] has been transported to Yatala Labour Prison , where he will serve out his custodial sentence , " said Alexander Downer , Foreign Minister and Philip Ruddock , Attorney-General in a joint press release .
#Text=" Law enforcement and security agencies are working together to determine appropriate security arrangements .

#Text= David Hicks is a political prisoner and it is just a complete human rights violation that our government can completely neglect one of its own citizens and leave him to rot in Guantanamo Bay , " said Steve Patroni , one of the protesters .

column1: #Text=At his trial , Hicks admitted he attended training camps in Afghanistan , conducted surveillance of the U.S. Embassy in Kabul and revealed that he had met Osama bin Laden , leader of Al-Qaeda .
#Text=He had participated in fighting against the U.S. and its allies in Afghanistan in late 2001 , and was caught while trying to flee the area .
#Text=Hicks is expected to be released from Australian prison by December , 2007 .
